author: Northman-de
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
- Start pwsh.exe (NOT as admin). 
- Go to window options -> Properties -> Options
- Check status of "QuickEdit Mode"
- Change mode
- execute any cmdlet, e.g. get-ChildItem (or just press return)
- check status of QuickEdit mode

Expected behavior
-----------------
QuickEdit still in mode you selected


Actual behavior
---------------
QuickEdit reverted back to status after start

Additional info
---------------
When you start pwsh.exe as admin, change the mode and close pwsh.exe the last set mode will be the new value for any non-admin pwsh.exe and can't be changed permanently for non-admins.

Tested on three computers (2x Win7, 1 Win10)


Environment data
----------------
```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.1.7601 S
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: QuickEdit status reverts after each cmdlet
